article_title: Michigan lead beats PPACA open enrollment
article_text:
U.S. adults told Kaiser they are much more interested in the presidential campaigns than in the PPACA exchange program. (LHP/Allison Bell)

U.S. adults seem to dislike the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) a little more now than they did this past summer, but they say they aren't giving PPACA all that much thought.

Analysts at the Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation have published data supporting those conclusions in a summary of results from a recent telephone survey of 1,201 U.S. adults ages 18 and older. The sample included 970 registered voters, including 382 Democrats, 335 Republicans and 324 independents.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Allison Bell
article_metadata.description: Americans are also more likely to say they are following Zika news

og.description: Americans are also more likely to say they are following Zika news "very" or "somewhat" closely.

article_summary:
U.S. adults told Kaiser they are much more interested in the presidential campaigns than in the PPACA exchange program.
(LHP/Allison Bell)U.S. adults seem to dislike the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) a little more now than they did this past summer, but they say they aren't giving PPACA all that much thought.
The sample included 970 registered voters, including 382 Democrats, 335 Republicans and 324 independents.
Analysts at the Henry J. Kaiser Family Foundation have published data supporting those conclusions in a summary of results from a recent telephone survey of 1,201 U.S. adults ages 18 and older.
